1.text: My son, if you accept my words and hide my commandments within you,

2.text: if you incline your ear to wisdom and direct your heart to understanding,

3.text: if you truly call out to insight and lift your voice to understanding,

4.text: if you seek it like silver and search it out like hidden treasure,

5.text: then you will discern the fear of the LORD and discover the knowledge of God.

6.text: For the LORD gives wisdom; from His mouth come knowledge and understanding.

7.text: He stores up sound wisdom for the upright; He is a shield to those who walk with integrity,

8.text: to guard the paths of justice and protect the way of His saints.

9.text: Then you will discern righteousness and justice and equityâ€”every good path.

10.text: For wisdom will enter your heart, and knowledge will delight your soul.

11.text: Discretion will watch over you, and understanding will guard you,

12.text: to deliver you from the way of evil, from the man who speaks perversity,

13.text: from those who leave the straight paths to walk in the ways of darkness,

14.text: from those who enjoy doing evil and rejoice in the twistedness of evil,

15.text: whose paths are crooked and whose ways are devious.

16.text: It will rescue you from the forbidden woman, from the stranger with seductive words

17.text: who abandons the partner of her youth and forgets the covenant of her God.

18.text: For her house sinks down to death, and her tracks to the departed spirits.

19.text: None who go to her return or negotiate the paths of life.

20.text: So you will follow in the ways of the good, and keep to the paths of the righteous.

21.text: For the upright will inhabit the land, and the blameless will remain in it;

22.text: but the wicked will be cut off from the land, and the unfaithful will be uprooted.
